title: Varadvinayak Temple, Mahad
subtitle: The Granter of Wishes among the revered Ashtavinayak Temples
overview: The Varadvinayak Temple at Mahad, located in the Khalapur taluka of Raigad district, is one of the eight sacred Ashtavinayak shrines of Lord Ganesha. The temple name 'Varadvinayak' means 'Bestower of Blessings' or 'Granter of Boons'.

It is believed that Lord Ganesha here fulfills the wishes of devotees who offer sincere prayers. The temple houses a self-manifested (Swayambhu) idol discovered in an adjoining lake over 300 years ago.
The present stone structure, built by Subhedar Ramji Mahadev Biwalkar in 1725 AD, exudes Peshwa-era architecture with a deep spiritual aura and serene surroundings.
Mahad’s peaceful setting, surrounded by green hills and a sacred pond, offers a divine and tranquil atmosphere for pilgrims visiting throughout the year.

highlights.title: Granter of Boons
highlights.description: Varadvinayak means the Lord who grants wishes and blessings to all who pray with devotion.

highlights.title: Swayambhu Idol from the Lake
highlights.description: The self-manifested Ganesha idol was discovered in a lake near the temple, symbolizing purity and divinity.

highlights.title: Historic Peshwa Architecture
highlights.description: Constructed in 1725 AD, the temple showcases traditional stone craftsmanship and wooden carvings.

geography.intro: The temple is located in Mahad village, about 8 km from Khopoli in Raigad district, nestled between scenic hills and ancient forests. Its location makes it easily accessible yet spiritually secluded.

climate.description: Mahad enjoys a tropical monsoon climate with pleasant winters, making it suitable for temple visits year-round.

geography.conclusion: The natural setting around the Varadvinayak Temple enhances the meditative experience, combining devotion and tranquility.

activities.title: Daily Darshan and Aarti
activities.description: Participate in morning and evening aartis to seek Lord Ganesha’s blessings.

activities.title: Holy Pond Ritual
activities.description: The sacred pond beside the temple is believed to purify the soul. Many devotees take a dip before darshan.
info: The pond is known as 'Swayambhu Kund'.
Offer prayers at the small shrine beside the pond.

activities.title: Meditation near the Temple Courtyard
activities.description: Surrounded by ancient banyan trees and chirping birds, it’s a peaceful spot for meditation and reflection.

attractions.title: Sacred Pond (Swayambhu Kund)
attractions.description: The holy pond where the self-manifested idol of Lord Ganesha was discovered.

attractions.title: Imagica Theme Park
attractions.description: Located nearby, a modern amusement park offering a fun outing for families after the pilgrimage.

marineLife.intro: Though not a coastal site, Mahad is enveloped in lush greenery and calm natural surroundings.

items.title: Green Landscape
items.description: The temple is surrounded by forested hills and peaceful nature.

items.title: Spiritual Serenity
items.description: The temple radiates calm and devotion, attracting seekers from across Maharashtra.

conclusion: Varadvinayak Temple combines faith, nature, and history.
It stands as a symbol of wish fulfillment and divine grace among the Ashtavinayak shrines.

howToReach.title: By Air
details: Nearest Airport: Mumbai International Airport (85 km).
Pune Airport is about 95 km away.

howToReach.title: By Rail
details: Regular trains connect Khopoli to Mumbai and Pune.

howToReach.title: By Road
details: Easily accessible by ST buses, private cars, and taxis.

bookingTips.description: Visit early morning or late evening to avoid rush and enjoy serene darshan.
Offer coconuts, modaks, and durva grass — traditional offerings to Lord Ganesha.
Combine Mahad visit with Ballaleshwar Pali (38 km away) for a two-temple Ashtavinayak trip.
